topic.title: Test note
topic.shortdesc: This file should test a lot of different attributes on the <note> tag.

body.note: This is a note to test @outputclass
This is a caution to test @outputclass
This is a note with no attributes set. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=attention. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=caution. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=danger. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=fastpath. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=important. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=note. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=other. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=other, and @othertype=MyOtherType. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=remember. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=restriction. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=tip. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.

p.b: NOW I NEED TO TEST ALL OF THE SAME THINGS, WITH @SPECTITLE ALSO SPECIFIED:

body.note: This is a note with no attributes set. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=caution. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=danger. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=note. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=other. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=other, and @othertype=MyOtherType. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=tip. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.

p.b: NOW I NEED TO TEST the first cases over again, with @othertype ALSO SPECIFIED:

body.note: This is a note with no attributes set. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=attention. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=caution. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=danger. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=fastpath. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=important. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=note. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=other. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=other, and @othertype=MyOtherType. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=remember. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=restriction. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.

p.b: NOW I NEED TO TEST ALL OF THE NOTES, WITH @OTHERTYPE AND @SPECTITLE BOTH SPECIFIED.

body.note: This is a note with no attributes set. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.
This is a note with @type=attention. Now let's add some text to make it really long and maybe even longer than that, because long notes are what I live for after all.

topic.title: Everything in a note
topic.shortdesc: This will test anything and everything in <note>. Just the normal note. No type attributes.

body.note:
Any note should of course start with basic text. Followed by other stuff. As for the other stuff, we'll put phrase-level stuff first. test apiname test bold (test boolean ->) test cite test cmdname test codeph test filepath test footnote test italic test inline image: test indexterm test keyword test menucascade/uicontrol test msgnum test msgph [skipping object] test option test parmname test ph testing a quote (test state -> ) test sub test sup test synph test systemoutput test term tm to amazon test tt test underlined test uicontrol test uicontrol/shortcut test userinput test varname test wintitle test xref to the top Now let's test block-level stuff:
test ul
test ul again
test ul again again testing a table in an example
testing a
basic table
testing a syntaxdiagram
simple list here
simple table simpler table end of simple table
simple table simpler table end of simple table
This is required cleanup in my exampletest pre test pre test pre pt this is a parml test
pt this is a parml test
testing a paragraph. That's a novel idea. well, if it is I should put it in <lq>.
test ol
test ol again
test ol a third time test msgblock test msgblock test msgblockLQ: Darryl Strawberry was sentenced to 18 months in prison Monday for violating his probation on a 1999 conviction on drug and solicitation of prostitution charges.test lines test lines test lines(that was a placement=break image)Figure in a section
Placing a figure in a section placing a draft-comment in the section
dl in section this is what a dl in a section looks like
dl in section this is what a dl in a section looks like test codeblock test codeblock test codeblock

note.screen: can I put a screen in a note? looks like the answer is yes
